title: Lucas Masterpieces Moripe Stadium
text:
Lucas "Masterpieces" Moripe Stadium is a <a href="multi-purpose%20stadium">multi-purpose stadium</a> having a capacity of 28,900 and is located in <a href="Atteridgeville">Atteridgeville</a>, a <a href="township%20%28South%20Africa%29">township (South Africa)</a> of <a href="Pretoria">Pretoria</a>, <a href="South%20Africa">South Africa</a>. It is currently used mostly for <a href="Association%20football">football</a> matches and serves as part-time home stadium of <a href="Premier%20Soccer%20League">Premier Soccer League</a> clubs <a href="Supersport%20United%20FC">Supersport United</a> and <a href="Mamelodi%20Sundowns">Mamelodi Sundowns</a> who also use the <a href="Loftus%20Versfeld%20Stadium">Loftus Versfeld Stadium</a>.
The stadium was named after former local soccer player <a href="Lucas%20Moripe">Lucas Moripe</a>. Until 2010 the stadium was known as Super Stadium.
The <a href="Germany%20national%20football%20team">Germany national football team</a> used it as a training venue during the <a href="2010%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">2010 FIFA World Cup</a>.
